content:
I am a USDA NIFA Postdoctoral Fellow in the Department of Entomology at the University of California, Riverside with Hollis Woodard. Currently, I study the effects of climate change on solitary bee development and fitness.
I completed my Ph.D. in Ecology at the University of California, Davis in 2022, advised by Neal Williams. For my dissertation, I studied the effects of pesticide exposure and resource stress on wild bee fitness and behavior.

title: Clara Stuligross
